definition: abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang

sentences.english: Today Victoria Harbour is one of the busiest and most magnificent ports in the world.
sentences.chinese: 香港本島被維多利亞港包圍在當中。

sentences.english: The night view of Victoria Harbour is one of the famous tourist spot in the world.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞港兩岸的夜景是世界上著名的觀光點之一。

sentences.english: I love Hongkong's Victoria Harbour so much. The view is great.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜歡香港的維多利亞港，那裏的景色太棒了。

sentences.english: Victoria Harbor is the natural harbor between the Kowloon Peninsula and the Hong Kong Island.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞港是九龍半島和香港島之間的天然良港。

sentences.english: Golden Bauhinia Square for the sea, which is the Victoria Harbor.
sentences.chinese: 金紫荊廣場面向海，也就是維多利亞港。

sentences.english: A photograph I took of Vitoria Harbor won second prize in a contest.
sentences.chinese: 我照的一張維多利亞港的照片，在比賽中得了第二名。

sentences.english: The Empress Hotel majestically overlooks Victoria's inner harbour .
sentences.chinese: 皇后酒店以宏偉的眼神俯瞰這維多利亞港的內灣。

definition: Victoria Harbor, Hong Kong/abbr. for 維多利亞港|维多利亚港[Wei2 duo1 li4 ya4 Gang3]
Saigon, capital of former South Vietnam/Sai Kung town in New Territories, Hong Kong
Wan Chai district of Hong Kong
top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
